column3: Can we have default no-op virtuals instead of the pure virtuals? EraseFromWallet doesn't make sense in non-wallet interfaces :)\n
Do you want to rename Register/UnregisterWallet?\n

Rename is a clear improvement, ACK.

Aside: I've always wondered if the intermediate abstract/virtual class makes sense at all. In principle anything could just subscribe/unsubscribe from the signals they care about, instead of having to inherit a class and add methods with specific names (potentially resulting in collisions).
CValidationInterface sounds like something that is doing validation, maybe CValidationClient or so? or CValidationReceiver? I dunno\n

CValidationClient? CValidationSignals? CValidationNotification? CValidationCallbacks? CValidationListener? CValidationVisitor?

Let the bikeshedding begin.
CValidationClient sounds fine. Prefer not to bikeshed this though, since there's now 4 deep PRs waiting on it :p (#5106, #3727, and #1816)\n
Sure, ACK regardless of what it's called. :)\n
